abstract: The 5.14-kilometer circuit, designed by the German architect and racetrack designer Hermann Tilke, will enable the fastest straight-line speed of any circuit in the world.
snippet: The 5.14-kilometer circuit, designed by the German architect and racetrack designer Hermann Tilke, will enable the fastest straight-line speed of any circuit in the world.
lead_paragraph: From our colleagues at the India Ink blog, a report on the newly built Buddh International Circuit racetrack, which is expected to accommodate 100,000 people when it holds the Formula One Grand Prix on Oct. 30. While the prelude to last year's Commonwealth Games in Delhi, a government-run endeavor, was fraught with chaos, India's first tryst with Formula One has been showered mainly with praise. Read more »

headline.main: At India's Formula One Track, a $400 Million Bet
